system.biography: "Stack the firewood... Help build the dam... Go fetch Old Trilla's goat... Oh, I'm sick of it! Is that what I have been preparing for? For this I broke my nose and lost a tooth in the training grounds? I'm ready for so much more than helping these farmers through yet another winter. What a bore! They say Stormhelm is fighting a war on the northern frontier. What acts of valor they must see! I mean, I don't want war to come here... I, I want everyone to be safe. But... is it so wrong to want to become the hero I know I can be?"
system.shortDescription: A STRAPPING YOUNG CONSTABLE PROTECTING  A SLEEPY VILLAGE AND DREAMING OF GLORY
system.notes:
Taking Actions

When you get the spotlight, the Narrator will tell you if you need one, two, or all three steps:

1. DESCRIBE YOUR ACTION

2. MAKE A ROLL

Count your action's POWER

  • +1 Power for every [helpful tag]

  • -1 Power for every [hindering tag]

  • + tier of highest [/sg helpful status ]

  • - tier of highest [/sg hindering status]

Roll two six-sided dice and add your Power to the total:

10 or more: Success!

7-9: Success and Consequences

6 or less: Consequences

3. SPEND YOUR POWER

  • Give or remove a [/sg status]: 1 Power per tier

  • Give or remove a [tag]: 2 Power per tag

  • Discover a detail: 1 Power

  • Perform an extra feat: 1 Power

Reactions

When you receive a negative status or tag, or lose a good status or tag, the Narrator may allow you to react to lessen the blow.

Describe your reaction, make a roll, and spend your Power to buy down the Consequences (1 Power per status tier, 2 Power per tag).

  • 10 or more: Spend Power+1, on any Effect

  • 7-9: Spend Power, only to lessen

  • 6 or less: Take the full Consequences

Hero Development

IMPROVE: Mark whenever the theme's weakness tag is invoked. When full, choose a new power tag or Special Improvement for that theme and reset the track

ABANDON: Mark whenever you ignore or betray the theme's Quest. When full, your theme is replaced.

MILESTONE: Mark whenever you achieve a goal of the theme's Quest. When full, your theme evolves.

system.description:
You have dedicated yourself to a person (a loved one, mentor, or dependent), a group (your circle of weavers or the village of Woodend), or an ideal (religion, creed, or way of life). Your devotion gives you meaning, drives you to carry on in difficult times, offers you something to go back to when the adventures are over, and serves as a framework for knowing right from wrong.

  • What is the most important thing to you, personally?

  • How did you end up caring so much about this person, group, or ideal?

  • Do you chafe under the needs, demands, or ethos of who or what you are devoted to?

  • How far would you go to protect that which you are devoted to?

powertag1.question: Who or what are you Devoted to?
powertag1.name: PROTECTOR  of THE DALES

powertag2.question: What action do you most commonly take in service of your Devotion?
powertag2.name: The Red Armor

powertag3.question: What feeling does your Devotion fill you with that you can call upon?
powertag3.name: Stand watch

powertag4.question: What possession do you carry or have that symbolizes your Devotion?
powertag4.name: Reassuring presence

powertag5.question: Where or when can you connect with your Devotion?
powertag5.name: Know these lands

powertag6.question: What does the object of your Devotion often help you with?
powertag6.name: Loyal riding horse

powertag7.question: What quality do you possess that best exemplifies your dedication?

powertag8.question: What approach do you take in social situations due to your Devotion?

powertag9.question: What ethos or saying do you aspire to live up to in your dedication?

powertag10.question: What useful ritual or habit do you have to show your Devotion?

weaknesstag1.question: What are you blind to because of your Devotion?
weaknesstag1.name: Burden of responsibility

weaknesstag2.question: What duties do you have that frequently need your time or resources?

weaknesstag3.question: What unsightly or destructive behavior can your Devotion evoke in you?

weaknesstag4.question: What often threatens the object of your Devotion?

specialImprovements.name: Bodyguard
specialImprovements.description: When your Devotion or a person representing it takes Consequence, you may take it instead of them (and possibly react to it), if the Narrator deems it possible.

specialImprovements.name: Catch Me When I Fall
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, when you act with the object of your Devotion or a person representing it at your side, and the outcome is only Consequences, you may choose to Succeed as well.

specialImprovements.name: Deeply Committed
specialImprovements.description: Your dedication fills you with purpose. Once per scene, when you take action to pursue this theme’s Quest, you may first gain [committed-2], which expires after that action.

specialImprovements.name: Goes Both Ways
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, if the object of your Devotion is near, you may gain a story tag representing aid granted by them, such as an item, encouragement, knowledge, or direct help.

specialImprovements.name: Unwavering
specialImprovements.description:
Once per session, when a tag in this theme would be scratched for any reason, you may 
keep it unscratched instead.

system.quest:
“I am sworn to guard this 
land and its people.“
system.story:
Finn is a new arrival at the village: a Red Marshal 
assigned to keep the peace and safety of the 
Dalish people, taking over from his retired 
predecessor. Everyone knows nothing ever 
happens in this quiet little dale, but nevertheless 
he often struts around in his a-little-too-shiny Red 
Armor, a practical boiled-leather vest that also 
serves as symbol of his station and a reminder of 
the responsibility he bears.

system.description:
You have a skill or ability you are somewhat good at, developed through practice or daily application over time. Or perhaps you’ve acquired a trade, which is more than a single honed skill – it’s a set of related techniques and understandings, with its own role in society. You might have learned a profession from a mentor, put to work in your family’s farm or shop, or practiced by yourself due to personal interest or out of necessity. You have become fairly good at what you do, and can trust your skills to carry you forward in most everyday situations.

  • • How did you acquire this skill or trade?

  • What are its everyday needs? What tools do you use?

  • How do others look upon you as a practitioner of this skill?

  • How do you keep your skills honed?

powertag1.question: What Skill or Trade are you good at?
powertag1.name: MARTIAL TRAINING

powertag2.question: What specific technique within this Skill set is your specialty?
powertag2.name: Swordsmanship

powertag3.question: What tool, equipment, or outfit is a staple of your Trade?
powertag3.name: Rally comrades

powertag4.question: Who most respects, values, or requires your abilities?
powertag4.name: Practiced footwork

powertag5.question: What unusual or inventive application have you found for your Skill?
powertag5.name: Iron focus

powertag6.question: In what conditions can you work with the most confidence and efficiency?
powertag6.name: Archery

powertag7.question: How do you reduce the risk of failure, harm, or poor outcome?

powertag8.question: What are you more aware of or know about, thanks to your Skill?

powertag9.question: Who assists you in practicing your Skill or Trade?

powertag10.question: What conviction or emotion motivates you to practice your Skill?

weaknesstag1.question: What challenge or feat is quite beyond your everyday ability?
weaknesstag1.name: Experienced foes

weaknesstag2.question: What conditions make it harder for you to practice your Skill or Trade?

weaknesstag3.question: How does your practice or talent bias your perceptions or interactions?

weaknesstag4.question: Where or when are those of your Trade unwelcome or unwilling to work?

specialImprovements.name: Deft Remedy
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, when you use tags from this theme and roll a total of 6 or less, you may reroll the dice and take the new result instead.

specialImprovements.name: Learn from My Mistakes
specialImprovements.description: Once per scene, when you act using tags from this theme and don’t Succeed, mark Improve on this theme.

specialImprovements.name: Practice Makes Perfect
specialImprovements.description: Choose a helpful status reflecting your use of your expertise such as [alert] or [well-off]. You may burn a tag from this theme at any time to gain that status at tier 3.

specialImprovements.name: Rehearsed Technique
specialImprovements.description: When you choose this Special, choose a power tag from this theme. Whenever you burn that tag for Power, you gain 3 Power as normal and may also forgo rolling the dice and treat the dice roll total as 7 (before adding Power).

specialImprovements.name: Resourceful
specialImprovements.description: When you camp or sojourn, if you dedicate your time to preparing or crafting something using your skill, you may create an extra story tag in addition to the usual benefits.

system.quest:
“Training keeps me ready 
for whatever may come.”
system.story:
After volunteering to join the Red Marshals, Finn 
apprenticed at Fort Gherdorn, their Barleytown 
barracks, spending years of rigorous arms 
training. He learned to wield swords, knives, axes 
and bows, or fi ght bare-handed, practicing in the 
sanded courtyard until he was bloody. He also 
learned to read missives and write reports. Today, 
he wonders what it was all for; it seems these 
skills will never truly be put to good use.

system.description:
You have a specific innate attribute that defines you, whether in your physique, your mind, or your heart – for example, you are strong, covered in scales, large-bodied, beautiful, cunning, or quick. Or, you possess some kind of special quality, unique to you, although not terribly out of the ordinary, such as being loved by animals. It could be something you were always well-known for while growing up or a recent transformation.

  • When did you first discover or become aware of your trait?

  • How reliant on this trait are you? Do you neglect developing relevant skills, or is it so good you simply don’t need to?

  • Who around you came to appreciate or resent this trait?

  • What can this trait help you achieve?

powertag1.question: What is your most defining Trait?
powertag1.name: ATHLETIC

powertag2.question: What is a specific or common way you put this Trait to use?
powertag2.name: Brute strength

powertag3.question: How is this Trait helping you keep safe?
powertag3.name: Runner’s stamina

powertag4.question: What item or ally helps you get the most of your Trait?
powertag4.name: Climbing

powertag5.question: What can you do that only those with this Trait can?
powertag5.name: Hardened physique

powertag6.question: In which situation is this Trait especially useful to you?
powertag6.name: All-terrain trekker

powertag7.question: What skill have you developed to make the most of this gift?

powertag8.question: What do you notice, sense, or understand that most other people cannot?

powertag9.question: How can you perform, show off, or be creative with your Trait?

powertag10.question: How do you hide this Trait, when you need to?

weaknesstag1.question: What happens when you overuse your Trait?
weaknesstag1.name: This is gonna hurt later

weaknesstag2.question: Who around you resents, covets, or mocks your Trait?

weaknesstag3.question: What is the most obvious vulnerability or misuse of this Trait?

weaknesstag4.question: When is your Trait utterly useless?

specialImprovements.name: Innate Sense
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, you can ask the Narrator for one important detail that you can intuit thanks to your Trait.

specialImprovements.name: Made for This
specialImprovements.description: Choose a hindering status that your Trait helps you overcome. Once per scene, you may ignore this status when you act.

specialImprovements.name: Moment to Shine
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, when you act using tags from this theme, you may ignore being Imperiled, or treat being Extremely Imperiled as being Imperiled.

specialImprovements.name: Pull Through
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, when you roll with tags from this theme, you may ignore any negative physical or emotional status of tier 3 or lower.

specialImprovements.name: Wild Blood
specialImprovements.description: Your Trait manifests in unusual ways. Choose and gain a Special Improvement from the Uncanny Being themebook.

system.story:
Red Marshal’s duty involves not only preparing 
for battle but also patrolling through the hills 
                    and woods, saving a stray farm animal from a 
                    deep ravine, or helping farmers to stack hay bales. 
                    Strapping and vigorous, Finn has the natural 
                    stamina and strength to help the people of his dale, 
                    and his training has only improved these abilities.

system.description:
You have a certain way of seeing the world and engaging with it, an archetypal personality type or way about you. You might have developed it during your younger years, or adopted it only lately, and it might not even be to your liking – but your personality is taking you places and defines how you interact with others. It could be that when times get tough, your true self comes out. Or maybe your persona is just a crutch, a defense that keeps people from getting too close.

  • What are you like?

  • What made you this way?

  • How well does your personality mesh with others’?

  • Is it all a show you’re putting on for the world? And if so, what’s beneath it?

powertag1.question: What Personality trait is most central to you?
powertag1.name: ASPIRING  LOCAL HERO

powertag2.question: In what situations does your Personality truly shine?
powertag2.name: Feign courage

powertag3.question: How do you influence other people?
powertag3.name: A villager’s shield

powertag4.question: What item or garment best expresses your personal style?
powertag4.name: Shortcuts to greatness

powertag5.question: What interpersonal or social skill or talent do you possess?
powertag5.name: Seize attention

powertag6.question: When in trouble or stressed, what emotion or behavior do you turn to?
powertag6.name: Village folk’s blessing

powertag7.question: What is an unexpected but useful facet of your Personality?

powertag8.question: How do you support or help others?

powertag9.question: How do you resist influence or stay true to yourself?

powertag10.question: How can your unique worldview help you figure things out?

weaknesstag1.question: In what situations does your Personality get you into trouble?
weaknesstag1.name: Rash

weaknesstag2.question: What is an ugly or unfortunate aspect of your Personality?

weaknesstag3.question: What unwanted behavior does your Personality push you toward?

weaknesstag4.question: Who finds you, or who do you find, irksome or loathsome?

specialImprovements.name: Adaptable Persona
specialImprovements.description: Once per session, when you take an action using tags from this theme and get only Consequences, you may choose to Succeed as well.

specialImprovements.name: Big Personality
specialImprovements.description: When you burn power tags from this theme for Power, they add 4 Power instead of 3.

specialImprovements.name: Infectious Personality
specialImprovements.description: When you camp or sojourn, you may give another Hero a story tag describing an aspect of your Personality (expiring any previous tag created this way).

specialImprovements.name: Lasting Impression
specialImprovements.description: Once per scene, when you take a social action and Succeed, you may give a [lasting impression] to everyone you affect with this action.

specialImprovements.name: Unshakeable
specialImprovements.description: Once per scene, when you react to lessen social or emotional Consequences and get a total result of 7 or above, you may spend all your Power to completely avoid all Consequence Effects.

system.story:
In his heart, Finn dreams of becoming a 
renowned hero and so he seeks adventure and 
jumps head first whenever the opportunity 
presents itself to show his mettle. While this has 
earned him the respect of some folk, others see 
him as a brash fool obsessed with glory. It seems 
a hero is in there, somewhere, but Finn must first 
find what truly matters to him most.
